definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: He's seen a pair of antlers, he's turning into a stag.
sentences.chinese: 从倒影中他看到一对鹿角，他已经变成一头雄鹿了。

sentences.english: And an autumn reflection , will deliver me to your arms.
sentences.chinese: 而一副秋日的倒影，将把我领入你的怀抱。

sentences.english: Mountains, now refreshingly green in the distant shores, made vacillating reflections in the water.
sentences.chinese: 远岸的重山透出清新的绿，在水中映出斑驳的倒影。

sentences.english: Lights, and Cup cross-video, mapping of the human reflection.
sentences.chinese: 灯火中，杯与光交影，映射着人与人之间的倒影。

sentences.english: Chuck Norris is so intimidating even his reflection won't look back at him.
sentences.chinese: 连罗礼士的水中倒影都要避免和他有眼神接触。

sentences.english: On the left you can easily see the huge shadow of the mountain's conical shape.
sentences.chinese: 你能轻易看出左边是山峰的巨大圆锥形倒影。

sentences.english: Reflections of the landscape in still water are an example of almost perfect symmetry.
sentences.chinese: 平静的水面上风景的倒影几乎是完美的对称例子。

sentences.english: Rafting roaming and saw a reflection of the lake-green water lake, full of poetic.
sentences.chinese: 泛舟漫游，只见一湖绿水半湖倒影，充满诗情画意。

sentences.english: But here the archetype fails because the reflection is not more perfect than the original.
sentences.chinese: 但是这个典型失败了，因为倒影并不比本人更完美。

sentences.english: After sunset the sky became beautifully multihued and reflected off the wet sand.
sentences.chinese: 日落之后的天空变得十分漂亮，倒影在潮湿的沙滩上。

sentences.english: As I was showering, I caught my reflection .
sentences.chinese: 当我淋浴时，我看到了自己的倒影。

sentences.english: This reflecting pool is larger and shallow, which mirrors the surrounding building and plants.
sentences.chinese: 这个倒影池较大，较浅，能够倒影周围的建筑和植物。

sentences.english: This reflecting pool is larger and shallow, which mirrors the surrounding building and plants.
sentences.chinese: 这个倒影池较大，较浅，能够倒影周围的建筑和植物。

sentences.english: On which are inverted dream-like reflections.
sentences.chinese: 许在漾着恋梦似的倒影。

sentences.english: Reflection of old housing as black and white ink paintings.
sentences.chinese: 枕河人家如墨色般倒影在黑白斑驳的光影中。

sentences.english: Similarly, a low angle, the reflection appears comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 同样，低角度拍摄，使倒影显得大而全。

definition: gleaming reflection of waves in sunlight
water and sky merge in one color (idiom)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
(of a light source) to cast one's light on/to project (an image)
